_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary

Facility:    MFA Bulk Plant - Bosworth
Location:    200 S. Kansas, Bosworth, Mo.
Contact:     Bill Hapes
Phone:     660-565-2216


1. The Facility Policy

MFA Incorporated and the employees of the MFA Bulk Plant in Bosworth are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Bosworth Fire Department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2. Facility Information

The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of bulk dry fertilizer and anhydrous ammonia for direct application as a crop nutrient.

The facility has (1) 12,000 gallon storage tank and the largest tank onsite would be a railroad tank car containing approximately 160,000 pounds. There may be occasions where multiple railroad tank cars would be located at the facility. The maximum quantity handled would be the unloading of a railroad tank car holding approximately 160,000 pounds. The facility also has (28) 1,000 gallon nurse tanks for product distribution.  

3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.

The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, 1981", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., the Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".

4. The Five-year Accident History

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.
